name: Velvet
author: Daniel Zerbino[1] , Ewan Birney
description: Velvet is an algorithm package that has been designed to deal with de novo genome assembly and short read sequencing alignments.

commands.name: velveth
commands.description: construct the dataset for the following program, velvetg, and indicate to the system what each sequence file represents.

arguments.name: output_directory
arguments.description: Directory where will be output files

arguments.name: strand_specific
arguments.description: Strand specific sequencing

arguments.name: m,M,s
arguments.description: Multiple k-mers: m â‰¤ k < M with a step of s

arguments.name: noHash
arguments.description: Preprocessing the Sequences file

arguments.name: reuse_Sequences
arguments.description: Preprocessing the Sequences file

arguments.name: create_binary
arguments.description: Using the binary version of Sequences

arguments.name: hash_length
arguments.description: Also known as k-mer length, corresponds to the length, in base pairs, of the words being hashed

arguments.name: file_format
arguments.description: Allows you to write as many filenames as you wish without having to re-type identical descriptors

arguments.name: read_type
arguments.description: Read type

arguments.name: filename
arguments.description: Name of file to analyse

commands.name: velvetg
commands.description: Build the Brujin graph and then manipulate it.

arguments.name: output_directory
arguments.description: Directory where will be output files

arguments.name: -cov_cutoff
arguments.description: removal of low coverage nodes AFTER tour bus or allow the system to infer it (default: no removal)

arguments.name: -min_contig_lgth
arguments.description: minimum contig length exported to contigs.fa file (default: hash length * 2)

arguments.name: -max_coverage
arguments.description: removal of high coverage nodes AFTER tour bus (default: no removal)

arguments.name: -exp_cov
arguments.description: expected coverage of unique regions or allow the system to infer it (default: no long or paired-end read resolution)

arguments.name: -ins_length
arguments.description: expected distance between two paired-end reads in the respective short-read dataset (default: no read pairing)

arguments.name: -shortMatePaired
arguments.description: for mate-pair libraries, indicate that the library might be contaminated with paired-end reads (default no)

arguments.name: -ins_length_long
arguments.description: expected distance between two long paired-end reads (default: no read pairing)

arguments.name: -scaffolding
arguments.description: scaffolding of contigs used paired end information (default: on)

arguments.name: -ins_length_long_sd
arguments.description: est. standard deviation of respective dataset (default: 10% of corresponding length)

arguments.name: -ins_length_sd
arguments.description: est. standard deviation of respective dataset (default: 10% of corresponding length)

arguments.name: -ins_length2_sd
arguments.description: est. standard deviation of respective dataset (default: 10% of corresponding length)

arguments.name: -ins_length2
arguments.description: expected distance between two paired-end reads in the respective short-read dataset (default: no read pairing)

arguments.name: -read_trkg
arguments.description: tracking of short read positions in assembly (default: no tracking)

arguments.name: -amos_file
arguments.description: export assembly to AMOS file (default: no export)

arguments.name: -amos_file
arguments.description: export assembly to AMOS file (default: no export)

arguments.name: -unused_reads
arguments.description: export unused reads in UnusedReads.fa file (default: no)

arguments.name: -max_branch_length
arguments.description: maximum length in base pair of bubble (default: 100)

arguments.name: -max_divergence
arguments.description: maximum divergence rate between two branches in a bubble (default: 0.2)

arguments.name: -max_gap_count
arguments.description: maximum number of gaps allowed in the alignment of the two branches of a bubble (default: 3)

arguments.name: -min_pair_count
arguments.description: minimum number of paired end connections to justify the scaffolding of two long contigs (default: 5)

arguments.name: -long_cov_cutoff
arguments.description: removal of nodes with low long-read coverage AFTER tour bus(default: no removal)

arguments.name: -coverage_mask
arguments.description: minimum coverage required for confident regions of contigs (default: 1)

arguments.name: -long_mult_cutoff
arguments.description: minimum number of long reads required to merge contigs (default: 2)

arguments.name: -alignments
arguments.description: export a summary of contig alignment to the reference sequences (default: no)

arguments.name: -exportFiltered
arguments.description: export the long nodes which were eliminated by the coverage filters (default: no)

arguments.name: -clean
arguments.description: remove all the intermediary files which are useless for recalculation (default : no)

arguments.name: -very_clean
arguments.description: remove all the intermediary files (no recalculation possible) (default: no)

arguments.name: -paired_exp_fraction
arguments.description: remove all the paired end connections which less than the specified fraction of the expected count (default: 0.1)

arguments.name: -conserveLong
arguments.description: preserve sequences with long reads in them (default no)
